testcase.name: testDocumentation_WhatHappens
testcase.system-out:
Template structure (OLD JXLS 1.x style): Row 3: Name: ${person.name} Row 4: Age: ${person.age} Row 6: <jx:if test="person.age < 18"> ← OLD syntax Row 7: Parent: ${person.parentName} Row 8: </jx:if> ← OLD syntax
======================================== NEGATIVE TEST: Using JXLS 1.x syntax with JXLS 2.x library ========================================
╔════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗ ║ WHAT HAPPENS WHEN YOU USE OLD SYNTAX WITH JXLS 2.x? ║ ╚════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝
JXLS 1.x Syntax (OLD): <jx:if test="person.age < 18"> Parent: ${person.parentName} </jx:if>
Behavior with JXLS 2.x: ❌ <jx:if> tag is treated as LITERAL TEXT ❌ </jx:if> tag is treated as LITERAL TEXT ❌ Variables ${...} are NOT evaluated (appear as literal text) ❌ Conditional logic does NOT work ❌ Template is copied AS-IS (no processing at all!)
Result: - The XML tags appear in your output Excel file - Variables like ${person.name} appear as literal text - Template processing completely fails - You MUST migrate to JXLS 2.x syntax
JXLS 2.x Syntax (NEW): jx:if(condition="person.age < 18", lastCell="B6") Parent: ${person.parentName}
Behavior with JXLS 2.x: ✅ Command is recognized and processed ✅ Condition is evaluated ✅ Content appears/disappears based on condition ✅ No command text appears in output
══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

testcase.name: testOldSyntaxIsIgnored_AdultCase
testcase.system-out:
=== Test 2: Adult (age >= 18) with OLD syntax ===
Output content: Row 1: [Person Report (OLD JXLS 1.x Style)] Row 2: Row 3: [Name:] [${person.name}] Row 4: [Age:] [${person.age}] Row 5: Row 6: [<jx:if test="person.age < 18">] Row 7: [Parent:] [${person.parentName}] Row 8: [</jx:if>] Row 9: Row 10: [⚠️ This template uses OLD JXLS 1.x syntax (won't work with JXLS 2.x)]
✓ CONFIRMED: Template not processed at all with old syntax - No variable evaluation occurs - Template copied as-is to output - This proves old syntax is completely incompatible
testcase.system-err: [main] INFO org.jxls.util.TransformerFactory - Loading transformer by class org.jxls.transform.poi.PoiTransformer

testcase.name: testComparison_OldVsNew
testcase.system-out:
=== Test 3: Side-by-side comparison ===
--- OLD syntax output --- Contains <jx:if>: true Contains parent name: false
--- NEW syntax output --- Contains jx:if command: true Contains parent name: false
✓ COMPARISON COMPLETE OLD: Shows jx:if as text, parent always appears NEW: Evaluates condition properly, parent conditionally appears
testcase.system-err: [main] INFO org.jxls.util.TransformerFactory - Loading transformer by class org.jxls.transform.poi.PoiTransformer [main] INFO org.jxls.util.TransformerFactory - Loading transformer by class org.jxls.transform.poi.PoiTransformer

testcase.name: testOldSyntaxIsIgnored_MinorCase
testcase.system-out:
=== Test 1: Minor (age < 18) with OLD syntax ===
Output content: Row 1: [Person Report (OLD JXLS 1.x Style)] Row 2: Row 3: [Name:] [${person.name}] Row 4: [Age:] [${person.age}] Row 5: Row 6: [<jx:if test="person.age < 18">] Row 7: [Parent:] [${person.parentName}] Row 8: [</jx:if>] Row 9: Row 10: [⚠️ This template uses OLD JXLS 1.x syntax (won't work with JXLS 2.x)]
✓ CONFIRMED: OLD syntax causes COMPLETE processing failure - Variables NOT evaluated: true - jx:if tags appear as text: true - Template copied as-is (no processing at all)
